attributes.action: Keep and improve rights for transgender and non-binary people in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details:
Through out all of the world, transgender and non-binary people face discrimination. This is seen a lot in the U.K. 41% of people in the U.K. identify as either a transgender man or a transgender women and of these 67% fear being open about the gender identity in case of being discriminated for it. 
As a young transgender man, I fear that although my gender and differences hasn't affected my classes it may end up affecting my ability to get the job I want. I think this should be an important thought for members of parliament as it will end up affecting everyone throughout the country if things do not change.
attributes.background:
Make all workplaces equal - this will prevent people being to scared to apply for certain jobs or being rejected.
Ensure people that discriminate against transgender people are prosecuted.

rejection.details:
We think this petition is similar

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/627984

If you'd like something else, you could start a new petition setting out what additional rights you'd like added.
